comment: Professor Moon is an extremely kind and caring person. However, she is by far the worst professor I have ever taken in my time at University. She takes seven+ weeks to put in grades. Her excuse is always that she is a Ph.D. student. She does not have time for this course, and it shows.

If I could give professor moon a zero, I would. She was extremely unorganized. She took almost 2 months to finally get grades in and she is a very tough grader. Communication is terrible. She takes days to respond to emails. Her emails are also very unprofessional. She gives no feedback. I understand people have lives, but this was just ridiculous.

Professor Moon is a good professor, but not great. She does care for her students but her teaching style and skills are just not up to the level of others at KSU. She focuses on reading off her power-points instead of giving a good, informational lecture which is one of the reasons I really struggled in her class.

Didn't even have the syllabus up until 2 days before drop/add. Grading and communication was a joke. Constantly went back and forth on things, pretended to care about students' opinions, then would do the exact opposite. Avoid like the plague.
Very understanding

She struggled with the D2L course setup so some assignments had to be omitted and the schedule was changed during the course. However, all assignments were straightforward. Weekly discussions, quizzes, a paper, and an online textbook. While grades were very delayed she was not a strict grader. She cares about the students and will work with you!

The class is so straight forward. Look over the PowerPoint before the weekly quiz and you will get an A. There was no final, extra credit opportunities, and lowest quiz dropped. She responded to my emails almost immediately. I would take her again and I recommend her to all CJ majors!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Accessible outside class

comment: I was looking forward to juvenile justice and my heart tbh sank when she straight up said she didnâ€™t even like teaching juvenile justice.. on the first day of class. Monotone voice 100% of the time. Not ADHD friendly. Acted like she was bored in her own class, unless she had the opportunity to talk about herself and her own separate interests.

This teacher is the most unorganized teacher I have ever met. She did not have all of the materials posted even after add/drop period was over. I would never take another class with her especially if you have a great GPA because her way of running her class will definitely make it drop! Find another professor if you can. You've been warned.

Professor Moon, while very relaxed and "chill", doesn't do too much to make her class enjoyable. I had her for Juvenile Justice and she expressed upon the first day that it wasn't even what she wanted to teach. Her lectures were extremely boring and the class content was very dull. I'd pass on this one.
super chill i like her

Professor Moon was always wanting to teach about more than just textbook Criminal Justice. Current events were always discussed, making the class more interesting. There was a quiz every week about the weekly chapters. Not very hard though! She focused more on teaching us about how we can change the criminal justice system. Loved her and recommend!

The class is comprised of a quiz every week that has questions word for word in the book. As long as you read a little bit you can get an easy A. The professor does take attendance but class is not really needed because all the information that is gone over is in the book.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor Moon is no doubt my favorite professor. She tells interesting personal stories during lectures. I think she's really funny. She's also super responsive to emails, she'll respond to your emails even at 2am. I would recommend this class to anyone. Only thing is you have to be disciplined enough to do a LOT of textbook reading to pass.

Professor Moon was funny and had lots of great stories. She gave lots of time to do assignments and she is flexible with late work. Her lectures were very interesting and I actually enjoyed listening to them.
Super nice but not the greatest teacher ever. She is very personable and will help you with anything as long as you show up and make an effort.

She tried. She blames the students for her failures, which is annoying, but the tests are easy as long as you take your time. Classes are extremely boring, though she will bring in interesting guests. All she does is read off PowerPoint and then gets off topic. She never seemed like she wanted to be there. It was a disappointing class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She really cares for her students and wants to get to know you. There are 4 tests, all open-book, open-note. She emails you back within at most 10 minutes. She's on top of everything. I loved having her. Highly recommend whether you're taking this class for credit or just as an elective.
Honestly one of the best teachers I have had, she is very nice and very funny keeps you entertained and will help you with anything even if it doesn't involve her class.

She is honestly the best professor i could've gotten for my first class in criminal justice, seeing as it is my major. She just wants you to pay attention. She makes sure to accommodate & move tests as needed. All of the tests are open note tests so pretty much just read the textbook & have it next to you while yo taking the test & you'll be fine.

Her lectures are beyond boring. She just reads from a powerpoint & makes the tests WAY harder than it needs to be. She's young but has an attitude problem. She blames the students for being uninterested & for not showing effort but she just doesn't know how to engage her students at all. Would not recommend. I'm a CJ major & she ruined 1101 for me.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader
